JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Elisabet Fura;Josep Casadevall;Luis López Guerra
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . He was represented before the ORG by Ms. PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) are represented by their Agent , Mr Răzvan - Horaţiu Radu , of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .
DATE and DATE , the applicant , who is of NORP origin , was compelled to carry out forced labour pursuant to the racist legislation passed by ORG .
Once the war was over , starting in DATE and until his retirement in DATE , the applicant worked for ORG and for several other administrative entities .
In DATE , he moved to GPE , where has continued to live to the present day .

On DATE ORG issued a decision , based on Decree no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , which regulates military pensions , granting the applicant his pension rights ( CARDINAL CARDINAL lei ( ROL ) per month ) with effect from DATE .
The applicant empowered ORG , who was resident in GPE , to cash his pension at ORG to which the money was sent .
From DATE until DATE , ORG collected the money without sending it to the applicant . The proxy was consequently revoked .
The pension payments corresponding to DATE and DATE were returned by ORG to ORG , as the money had never been collected and ORG had been unable to contact ORG

On DATE , in reply to a letter sent by the applicant on DATE , ORG informed him that ORG and Other Insurance Rights ( ORG ) was responsible , under its authority , for the system of civil pensions . The ORG had signed an agreement with the Bancpost ( ORG ) allowing bank transfers of civil pensions to be made to the beneficiaries ' accounts in GPE . However , as the applicant was the beneficiary of a military pension , he was advised to contact ORG , which was the authority responsible for managing the military pension system , as the CARDINAL pension systems were different and were managed separately .

This information was confirmed by a letter of DATE from GPE to the applicant , in which he was informed that the bank had concluded an agreement with ORG , but only with regard to retirement pensions regulated by the ORG ( civil pensions ) . The agreement did not cover the transfer of military pensions awarded by ORG or by ORG .

At DATE the applicant asked for his pension to be transferred to his NORP account . He contended that his old age and state of health prevented him from travelling to GPE on a DATE basis in order to collect his pension from ORG . In his letter the applicant also referred to the fact that ORG had stopped sending him the pension payments she had cashed , and he had therefore revoked the proxy . Furthermore , as he had left GPE DATE before , he did not know any other person whom he could appoint as his proxy for the purpose of collecting his pension payments on a DATE basis .

In its reply of DATE , ORG informed the applicant that it could not transfer pensions into accounts opened with GPE , as it had only signed agreements with ORG , which was not part of the banking system .

ORG also indicated that the applicant could opt to ask his proxy to transfer the money he / she collected to any account he named . He was also told that in case of disagreement with the proxy , he always had the option of appointing another representative .

On DATE ORG again informed the applicant that no agreement had been concluded by ORG with any bank allowing transfers of military retirement pensions abroad . In any event , according to the new LAW no . CARDINAL regulating military pensions , the money was to be paid directly to the beneficiary or to his legal proxy empowered to cash it . The actual payment was to be collected directly from ORG .
Hence , ORG invited the applicant to appoint a proxy and informed him that from DATE the validity of such a mandate was limited to DATE . No legal basis for that time - limit was indicated .

In a letter sent to the applicant on DATE the ORG 's Secretariat General confirmed that an agreement concluded between ORG and ORG allowed for the payment of military pensions either to the beneficiary himself , or to his appointed proxy . The applicant was informed that he could ask his proxy at any time to transfer the money to him abroad .
Attempting to argue that his pension was a civil and not a military one , the applicant pointed out that the ORG should be the institution responsible for managing his retirement file .

On DATE ORG replied that the applicant 's pension had been awarded on the basis of Decree no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , which regulated State military pensions , and therefore it could only be paid in accordance with the relevant provisions therein .

On CARDINAL DATE ORG informed the applicant that , according to the legislation in force , if the beneficiary of a pension resided abroad , his pension , whether it was military or civil , was only to be paid to a legal proxy empowered to collect the money . This person , once appointed , could then ask ORG to transfer the money to an account opened with ORG , and afterwards , to an account opened with a bank in GPE .

On DATE the applicant asked to have his rights granted by Legislative Decree no . PERSON acknowledged , as he had been racially persecuted by the regime established by PERSON . According to this decree , the pecuniary rights referred to a DATE indemnity of CARDINAL lei ( ROL ) per year of detention . This indemnity was subject to several increments , reaching the sum of CARDINAL ROL per DATE of detention by CARDINAL DATE .
Persons having proved they had suffered persecution were also entitled , under the decree , to other rights , such as free medical assistance , free public transport and exemption from paying taxes .

On DATE ORG ( ORG ) issued a decision granting the applicant 's request and indicating , without any other details , that from DATE he would benefit from all the rights granted by Legislative Decree no . ORG for the period from CARDINAL DATE to DATE when he had been persecuted .
The applicant applied to his former employer , ORG , asking for the above - mentioned decision to be enforced .
On DATE the Ministry informed the applicant that , according to the law , the responsible institution was the ORG , under the authority of ORG .

In a letter of CARDINAL DATE , the ORG informed the applicant that the indemnities granted by Legislative Decree no . ORG could not be paid to him . Firstly , it was explained to him , his file had been transmitted on DATE to ORG , LOC , as the competent institution to make the payments .

However , payment had never been approved , because the file should have been filed personally by the applicant and not sent by post , or at least a representative of the applicant appointed for that specific purpose should have filed the request in his name . In consequence , the applicant 's request and all the supporting documents were returned to him .

On DATE , following further requests from the applicant to be paid the indemnities he was entitled to , the ORG informed him that his file could not be processed because he had not appointed a proxy , as they had already mentioned in their previous letters . Consequently , any other similar request from the applicant would be ignored ( “ any new request to our institution with identical complaints will receive no reply ” ) .
To date the ORG has not calculated the exact amount of the indemnities due to the applicant .

In a letter of DATE , the ORG informed the ORG that the procedure instituted by LAW no . ORG required the money to be paid to the beneficiary in person , or to his appointed proxy . The proxy was to be empowered to file any request , open an account with GPE , collect the indemnities paid and inform the authorities of any change in the beneficiary 's status which might affect the indemnity . All this information had been provided to the applicant , who had failed to comply with the requirement of appointing a proxy .

The ORG also mentioned that once the applicant 's file was complete , as required by the law , the indemnities could be paid directly to GPE , following a specific request filed by the applicant with an NORP bank that had signed an agreement with GPE for that purpose .

Legislative Decree no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE on the granting of certain rights to persons who were persecuted on political grounds by the dictatorial regime established on DATE , as modified by ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE
At the material time , the relevant provisions of Legislative Decree no . ORG , as completed by the provisions of ORG no . CARDINAL , read :

“ ( CARDINAL ) The following periods shall be taken into account in determining seniority and shall count as such for the purpose of calculating retirement pensions and any other rights derived from seniority : periods during which a person , after DATE , for political reasons –
served a custodial sentence imposed in a final judicial decision , or was detained pending trial for political offences ; [ ... ]
( CARDINAL ) The same rights will be granted to the person who :
( ORG ) was persecuted or deported for racial or ethnic reasons by the regime established in GPE from DATE to DATE [ ... ] ”
“ The persons referred to in LAW are entitled to receive a DATE indemnity of CARDINAL lei for DATE of detention [ ... ] ”
“ The persons referred to in LAW shall be exempted from the payment of any taxes .
These persons will also benefit from the following rights :
a ) free medical assistance and free medication , which are to be allowed with priority both in the community and while hospitalized ;

b ) free urban transport – public ( bus , tram , subway ) or private ; the costs relating to travelling with a private company shall be reimbursed by the local administrative authorities corresponding to the beneficiary 's residence ;
c ) CARDINAL free tickets for travelling by train , first class [ ... ] ;
d ) CARDINAL free ticket per year for medical treatment in a treatment resort ;
e ) exemption from the payment of radio and television licences ;
f ) priority treatment for setting up a phone line [ ... ] ;
g ) upon request , the granting of a free burial plot . ”
NORP citizens residing abroad will also benefit from the rights set out within the provisions of the present legislative decree .

Law no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL regulating the public pension system and all other insurance rights
“ The payment of pension rights will be made on a DATE basis .
The pension will be paid either personally to its beneficiary , to his legally appointed proxy , or to his legal representative . ”
Law no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL regulating military pensions
“ ( CARDINAL ) The payment of pension rights will be made on a DATE basis .
